summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021 between a U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutor and FBI/NYPD task force members regarding witness preparation for a case. It involves requests for background checks (rap sheets) and information on potential testifying witnesses, indicating ongoing investigative or pre-trial activity related to child exploitation and human trafficking.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York who is coordinating witness checks and requesting rap sheets for potential testifying witnesses by a deadline.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: A detective on a joint FBI/NYPD task force who is being asked to provide background information and rap sheets on witnesses for a case.

connections.person2: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
connections.description: The prosecutor is requesting the detective's assistance in conducting background checks (rap sheets) on potential witnesses for a case.

events.title: Initial Witness List Request
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends a list of potential testifying witnesses to law enforcement, requesting rap sheets by Wednesday or Thursday of that week.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

events.title: Follow-up on Witness Information
events.description: Email follow-ups request more detailed information on witnesses, including DOBs, ages, reasons for testifying, and locations.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The communication is between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and members of an FBI/NYPD Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force in October 2021.
The prosecutor is actively preparing for witness testimony in a case, requesting background checks (rap sheets) on a list of potential witnesses.
The subject matter involves child exploitation and human trafficking, indicating the case is related to these crimes.
The emails show a collaborative investigative effort between federal prosecutors and joint federal-local law enforcement task forces.
